<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">On November&nbsp;1, 2021, the company completed the sale of MaxFoods Pty Ltd, an Australian packaged seafood
business that it had acquired as part of its acquisition of Gourmet Food Holdings Pty Ltd (&#147;Gourmet Food&#148;). The sales price was $57&nbsp;million Australian dollars ($41 million), net of cash divested with the business, and the company
recorded an immaterial loss on the transaction. The divestiture of this business resulted in a year-over-year decline in net revenues of $16&nbsp;million in the three months and $30&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Acquisitions, Acquisition-related costs and Acquisition integration costs and contingent consideration
adjustments </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Acquisition-related costs, which includes transaction costs such as third party advisor, investment banking and legal fees, also
includes <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-time</FONT> compensation expense related to the buyout of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-vested</FONT> employee stock ownership plan shares. Acquisition integration costs and contingent
consideration adjustments include <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-time</FONT> costs related to the integration of acquisitions as well as any adjustments made to the fair market value of contingent compensation liabilities that have been
previously booked for earn-outs related to acquisitions that do not relate to employee compensation expense. The company excludes these items to better facilitate comparisons of our underlying operating performance across periods. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On November&nbsp;1, 2022, the company acquired Grupo Bimbo&#146;s confectionery business, Ricolino, located primarily in Mexico. The company incurred
acquisition-related costs of $1&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022. The company also incurred acquisition integration costs of $7&nbsp;million in the three and nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On August&nbsp;1, 2022, the company acquired 100% of the equity of Clif Bar&nbsp;&amp; Company (&#147;Clif Bar&#148;), a leading U.S. maker of nutritious
energy bars with organic ingredients. The acquisition expands our global snacks bar business and complements our refrigerated snacking and performance nutrition bar portfolios. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of $157&nbsp;million
during the three and nine months ended September&nbsp;30,2022, and an operating loss of $33&nbsp;million during the three and nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022. The operating loss includes acquisition integration costs and contingent
consideration adjustments of $16&nbsp;million and an inventory <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">step-up</FONT> charge of $20&nbsp;million incurred during the three and nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022. The company also incurred
acquisition-related costs of $292&nbsp;million in the three months and $296&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022. These acquisition-related costs are primarily related to the buyout of the
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-vested</FONT> employee stock ownership plan shares. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On January&nbsp;3, 2022, the company acquired Chipita Global
S.A. (&#147;Chipita&#148;), a leading croissants and baked snacks company in the Central and Eastern European markets. The acquisition of Chipita offers a strategic complement to the company&#146;s existing portfolio and advances its strategy to
become the global leader in broader snacking. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of $158&nbsp;million during the three months and $490&nbsp;million during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022, and operating income of
$25&nbsp;million during the three months and $39&nbsp;million during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022. The company incurred acquisition-related costs of $21&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022, and
$6&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. The company also incurred acquisition integration costs of $14&nbsp;million in the three months and $85&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022, and
$6&nbsp;million in the three and nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On April&nbsp;1, 2021, the company acquired Gourmet Food Holdings Pty Ltd, a
leading Australian food company in the premium biscuit and cracker category. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of $14&nbsp;million and operating income of $1&nbsp;million during the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022. The company
incurred acquisition integration costs of $1&nbsp;million in the three and nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022. The company also incurred acquisition-related costs of $7&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On March&nbsp;25, 2021, the company acquired a majority interest in Lion/Gemstone Topco Ltd (&#147;Grenade&#148;), a performance nutrition leader in the
United Kingdom. The acquisition of Grenade expands the company&#146;s position into the premium nutrition segment. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of $21&nbsp;million and operating income of $2&nbsp;million during the nine months
ended September&nbsp;30, 2022. The company incurred acquisition-related costs of $2&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On
January&nbsp;4, 2021, the company acquired the remaining 93% of equity of Hu Master Holdings, a category leader in premium chocolate in the United States, which provides a strategic complement to the company&#146;s snacking portfolio in North
America through growth opportunities in chocolate and other offerings in the well-being segment. The initial cash consideration paid was $229&nbsp;million, net of cash received, and the company may be required to pay additional contingent
consideration. The estimated fair value of the contingent consideration obligation at the acquisition date was $132&nbsp;million and was determined using a Monte Carlo simulation based on forecasted future results. During the third quarter of 2021,
the company recorded a $70&nbsp;million reduction to the liability due to changes in the expected pace of growth. During the third quarter of 2022, the company recorded an additional $7&nbsp;million reduction to the liability due to further changes
to forecasted future results. As a result of acquiring the remaining equity interest, the company consolidated the operation and recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $9&nbsp;million ($7&nbsp;million <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> related to stepping up the company&#146;s previously-held $8&nbsp;million (7%) investment to fair value. The company incurred acquisition-related costs of $9&nbsp;million in the three and nine months
ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On April&nbsp;1, 2020, the company acquired a majority interest in Give&nbsp;&amp; Go, a North American
leader in fully-finished sweet baked goods and owner of the famous <I><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">two-bite</FONT></I><I><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">&reg;</SUP></I> brand of brownies and the
<I><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Create-A-Treat</FONT></FONT></I><I><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">&reg;</SUP></I> brand, known for cookie and gingerbread house decorating kits. The acquisition of
Give&nbsp;&amp; Go provides access to the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">in-store</FONT> bakery channel and expands the company&#146;s position in broader snacking. The company incurred acquisition integrations costs of $1&nbsp;million in the nine
months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022, and $3&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Simplify to Grow Program </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The primary objective of the Simplify to Grow Program is to reduce the company&#146;s operating cost structure in both its supply chain and overhead costs. The
program covers severance as well as asset disposals and other manufacturing and procurement-related <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-time</FONT> costs. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Restructuring costs </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company recorded a
$10&nbsp;million gain due to the sale of assets included in the restructuring program as well as restructuring charges of $3&nbsp;million in the three months and restructuring charges of $8&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30,
2022. The company recorded restructuring charges of $62&nbsp;million in the three months and $250&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. This activity was recorded within asset impairment and exit costs and benefit plan <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-service</FONT> income. These charges were for severance and related costs, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> asset write-downs (including accelerated depreciation and asset impairments) and other
adjustments, including any gains on sale of restructuring program assets. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Implementation costs </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Implementation costs primarily relate to reorganizing the company&#146;s operations and facilities in connection with its supply chain reinvention program and
other identified productivity and cost saving initiatives. The costs include incremental expenses related to the closure of facilities, costs to terminate certain contracts and the simplification of the company&#146;s information systems. The
company recorded implementation costs of $23&nbsp;million in the three months and $62&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022 and $65&nbsp;million in the three months and $132&nbsp;million in the nine months ended
September&nbsp;30, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Intangible asset impairment charges </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the company&#146;s 2022 annual testing of indefinite-life intangible assets, the company recorded a $23&nbsp;million intangible asset impairment charge
in the third quarter of 2022 related to one brand. The impairment arose due to lower than expected growth and profitability in a local biscuit brand in AMEA. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the first quarter of 2022, the company recorded a $78&nbsp;million intangible asset impairment charge in AMEA due to lower than expected growth and
profitability of a local biscuit brand sold in select markets in AMEA and Europe. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the second quarter of 2021, the company recorded a
$32&nbsp;million intangible asset impairment charge in North America related to a small biscuit brand, primarily due to lower than expected sales growth. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity and currency derivative contracts
</I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company excludes unrealized gains and losses <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">(mark-to-market</FONT></FONT>
impacts) from outstanding commodity and forecasted currency and equity method investment transaction derivative contracts from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> earnings measures. The <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts of commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivatives are excluded until such time that the related exposures impact the company&#146;s operating results. Since the company
purchases commodity and forecasted currency transaction contracts to mitigate price volatility primarily for inventory requirements in future periods, the company makes this adjustment to remove the volatility of these future inventory purchases on
current operating results to facilitate comparisons of its underlying operating performance across periods. The company excludes equity method investment derivative contract settlements as they represent protection of value for future divestitures.
The company recorded net unrealized losses on commodity, forecasted currency and equity method transaction derivatives of $120&nbsp;million in the three months and $220&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022, and recorded net
unrealized gains of $134&nbsp;million in the three months and $268&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Remeasurement of
net monetary position </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the first quarter of 2022, primarily based on data published by the T&uuml;rkiye Statistical Institute that indicated
that T&uuml;rkiye&#146;s three-year cumulative inflation rate exceeded 100%, the company concluded that T&uuml;rkiye became a highly inflationary economy for accounting purposes. As of April&nbsp;1, 2022, the company began to apply highly
inflationary accounting for its subsidiaries operating in T&uuml;rkiye and changed their functional currency from the Turkish lira to the U.S. dollar. Within selling, general and administrative expenses, we recorded a remeasurement gain of
$1&nbsp;million during the three and nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022 related to the revaluation of the Turkish lira denominated net monetary position over these periods. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the second quarter of 2018, primarily based on published estimates which indicated that
Argentina&#146;s three-year cumulative inflation rate exceeded 100%, the company concluded that Argentina became a highly inflationary economy for accounting purposes. As of July&nbsp;1, 2018, the company began to apply highly inflationary
accounting for its Argentinean subsidiaries and changed their functional currency from the Argentinean peso to the U.S. dollar. Within selling, general and administrative expenses, the company recorded remeasurement losses of $12&nbsp;million in the
three months and $27&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022 and $2&nbsp;million in the three months and $10&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021 related to the revaluation of the Argentinean peso
denominated net monetary position over these periods. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Impact from pension participation changes </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The impact from pension participation changes represent the charges incurred when employee groups are withdrawn from multiemployer pension plans and other
changes in employee group pension plan participation. The company excludes these charges from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results because those amounts do not reflect the company&#146;s ongoing pension obligations. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the second quarter of 2021, the company made a decision to freeze its Defined Benefit Pension Scheme in the United Kingdom. As a result, the company
recognized a curtailment credit of $3&nbsp;million in the three months and $17&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021 recorded within benefit plan <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-service</FONT> income. In addition, the
company incurred incentive payment charges and other expenses related to this decision of $2&nbsp;million in the three months and $47&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021 included in operating income. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On July&nbsp;11, 2019, the company received an undiscounted withdrawal liability assessment related to the company&#146;s complete </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">withdrawal from the Bakery and Confectionery Union and Industry International Pension Fund totaling $526&nbsp;million and requiring <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pro-rata</FONT> monthly payments over 20 years. The company began making monthly payments during the third quarter of 2019. In connection with the discounted long-term liability, the company recorded accreted interest of
$3&nbsp;million in the three months and $8&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022 and $2&nbsp;million in the three months and $8&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021 within interest and other expense,
net. As of September&nbsp;30, 2022, the remaining discounted withdrawal liability was $348&nbsp;million, with $15&nbsp;million recorded in other current liabilities and $333&nbsp;million recorded in long-term other liabilities. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Incremental costs due to the war in Ukraine </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In
February 2022, Russia began a military invasion of Ukraine and the company closed its operations and facilities in Ukraine. In March 2022, the company&#146;s two Ukrainian manufacturing facilities in Trostyanets and Vyshhorod were significantly
damaged. During the first quarter of 2022, the company evaluated and impaired these and other assets. The company recorded $143&nbsp;million of total expenses ($145&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> incurred as a direct
result of the war, including $75&nbsp;million recorded in asset impairment and exit costs, $44&nbsp;million in cost of sales and $24&nbsp;million in selling, general and administrative expenses. The company reversed approximately $7&nbsp;million in
the three months and $22&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022 of previously recorded charges primarily as a result of higher than expected collection of trade receivables and inventory recoveries. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Loss on debt extinguishment and related expenses </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On March&nbsp;18, 2022, the company completed a tender offer and redeemed long-term U.S. dollar denominated notes totaling $987&nbsp;million. The company
recorded a $129&nbsp;million loss on debt extinguishment and related expenses within interest and other expense, net, consisting of $38&nbsp;million paid in excess of carrying value of the debt and from recognizing unamortized discounts and deferred
financing costs in earnings and $91&nbsp;million in unamortized forward starting swap losses in earnings at the time of the debt extinguishment. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On
March&nbsp;31, 2021, the company completed an early redemption of euro (&#128;1,200 million) and U.S. dollar ($992 million) denominated notes. The company recorded a $137&nbsp;million loss on debt extinguishment and related expenses within interest
and other expense, net, consisting of $110&nbsp;million paid in excess of carrying value of the debt and from recognizing unamortized discounts and deferred financing costs in earnings and $27&nbsp;million foreign currency derivative loss related to
the redemption payment at the time of the debt extinguishment. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Initial impacts from enacted tax law changes </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company excludes initial impacts from enacted tax law changes from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures as they do not
reflect its ongoing tax obligations under the enacted tax law changes. Initial impacts include items such as the remeasurement of deferred tax balances and the transition tax from the 2017 U.S. tax reform. Previously, the company only excluded the
initial impacts from more material tax reforms, specifically the impacts of the 2019 Swiss tax reform and 2017 U.S. tax reform. To facilitate comparisons of its underlying operating results, the company has recast all
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">historical&nbsp;non-GAAP&nbsp;earnings</FONT> measures to exclude the&nbsp;initial impacts from enacted tax law changes. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company recorded net tax expense from the increase of its deferred tax liabilities resulting from
enacted tax legislation of $13&nbsp;million in the three months and $22&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2022. The company recorded a net tax benefit of $4&nbsp;million from a decrease of its deferred tax liabilities
resulting from enacted tax legislation in the three months and a net tax expense from the increase of its deferred tax liabilities resulting from enacted tax legislation (mainly in the United Kingdom) of $95&nbsp;million in the nine months ended
September&nbsp;30, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Gains and losses on equity method investment transactions </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>JDE Peet&#146;s transaction </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On May&nbsp;8, 2022, the
company sold approximately 18.6&nbsp;million of our JDE Peet&#146;s shares back to JDE Peet&#146;s, which reduced our ownership interest by approximately 3% to 19.8%. The company received &#128;500&nbsp;million ($529 million) of proceeds and
recorded a loss of &#128;8&nbsp;million ($8 million) on this sale during the second quarter of 2022. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Keurig Dr Pepper transactions </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On August&nbsp;2, 2021, the company sold approximately 14.7&nbsp;million shares of KDP, which reduced its ownership interest by 1% to 5.3% of the total
outstanding shares. The company received $500&nbsp;million of proceeds and recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $248&nbsp;million (or $189&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> during the third
quarter of 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On June&nbsp;7, 2021, the company participated in a secondary offering of KDP shares and sold approximately 28&nbsp;million shares,
which reduced its ownership interest by 2% to 6.4% of the total outstanding shares. The company received $997&nbsp;million of proceeds and recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $520&nbsp;million (or $392&nbsp;million <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> during the second quarter of 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company considers these ownership reductions partial divestitures of
its equity method investment in KDP. Therefore, the company has removed the equity method investment net earnings related to the divested portion from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial results for Adjusted EPS for all
historical periods presented to facilitate comparison of results. The company&#146;s U.S. GAAP results, which include its equity method investment net earnings from KDP, did not change from what was previously reported. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Equity method investee items </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Within Adjusted EPS,
the company&#146;s equity method investment net earnings exclude its proportionate share of its equity method investees&#146; significant operating and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-operating</FONT> items, such as acquisition and
divestiture-related costs, restructuring program costs and initial impacts from enacted tax law changes. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Constant currency </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Management evaluates the operating performance of the company and its international subsidiaries on a constant currency basis. The company determines its
constant currency operating results by dividing or multiplying, as appropriate, the current period local currency operating results by the currency exchange rates used to translate the company&#146;s financial statements in the comparable prior-year
period to determine what the current-period U.S. dollar operating results would have been if the currency exchange rate had not changed from the comparable prior-year period. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>OUTLOOK </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company&#146;s outlook for 2022 Organic Net Revenue growth, Adjusted EPS growth on a constant currency basis and Free Cash Flow are <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures that exclude or otherwise adjust for items impacting comparability of financial results such as the impact of changes in currency exchange rates, restructuring activities, acquisitions
and divestitures. The company is not able to reconcile its projected Organic Net Revenue growth to its projected reported net revenue growth for the full-year 2022 because the company is unable to predict during this period the impact from potential
acquisitions or divestitures, as well as the impact of currency translation due to the unpredictability of future changes in currency exchange rates, which could be material as a significant portion of the company&#146;s operations are outside the
U.S. The company is not able to reconcile its projected Adjusted EPS growth on a constant currency basis to its projected reported diluted EPS growth for the full-year 2022 because the company is unable to predict during this period the timing of
its restructuring program costs, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT> impacts from commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivative contracts and impacts from potential acquisitions or divestitures as well as the impact of
currency translation due to the unpredictability of future changes in currency exchange rates, which could be material as a significant portion of the company&#146;s operations are outside the U.S. The company is not able to reconcile its projected
Free Cash Flow to its projected net cash from operating activities for the full-year 2022 because the company is unable to predict during this period the timing and amount of capital expenditures impacting cash flow. Therefore, because of the
uncertainty and variability of the nature and amount of future adjustments, which could be significant, the company is unable to provide a reconciliation of these measures without unreasonable effort. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Reconciliation of GAAP to Non-GAAP Measures </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Net Revenues </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(in
millions of U.S. dollars) </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Unaudited) </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TR STYLE="font-size:1px; ">
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><U>Schedule 5b </U></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Reconciliation of GAAP to Non-GAAP Measures </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Gross Profit / Operating Income </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(in millions of U.S. dollars) </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Unaudited) </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="18" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>For the Nine Months Ended September&nbsp;30, 2022</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>Net</B><br><B>Revenues</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>Gross</B><br><B>Profit</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">

// Edgar(tm) Renderer was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.
var Show={};Show.LastAR=null,Show.showAR=function(a,r,w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d,p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}
</TEXT>

/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */

/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}

..report table.authRefData a {
	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report table.authRefData p {
	margin-top: 0px;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide {
	background-color: #2F4497;
	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
	background-color: #2F4497;
}

..report table.authRefData .body {
	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}

..report table.authRefData table{
	font-size: 1em;
}

/* Report Styles */
..pl a, .pl a:visited {
	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}

/* table */
..report {
	background-color: white;
	border: 2px solid #acf;
	clear: both;
	color: black;
	font: normal 8pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	margin-bottom: 2em;
}

..report hr {
	border: 1px solid #acf;
}

/* Top labels */
..report th {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
}

..report th.void	{
	background-color: transparent;
	color: #000000;
	font: bold 10pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	text-align: left;
}

..report .pl {
	text-align: left;
	vertical-align: top;
	white-space: normal;
	width: 200px;
	white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}

..report td.pl a.a {
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	width: 200px;
	overflow: hidden;
}

..report td.pl div.a {
	width: 200px;
}

..report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}

/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}

/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}

/* Even rows... */
..report .re, .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}

..report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro, .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}

..report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

..report .rou table td, .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}

/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}

/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num, .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}

..report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}

..report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}

/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}

..report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}

..report .text .more {
	display: none;
}

..report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report .text .small {
	width: 10em;
}

..report sup {
	font-style: italic;
}

..report .outerFootnotes {
	font-size: 1em;
}
</TEXT>
